body_html:
On our cluster, we have a bunch of K80's as well. I just ran your example, and nothing went wrong.

For reference, I am running the docker implementation, and I had to change one line of your code, because it was throwing depreciation warnings.
I changed, tf.initialize_all_variables() to tf.global_variables_initializer()
body_text:
On our cluster, we have a bunch of K80's as well. I just ran your example, and nothing went wrong.
For reference, I am running the docker implementation, and I had to change one line of your code, because it was throwing depreciation warnings.
I changed, tf.initialize_all_variables() to tf.global_variables_initializer()
body:
On our cluster, we have a bunch of K80's as well. I just ran your example, and nothing went wrong.

For reference, I am running the docker implementation, and I had to change one line of your code, because it was throwing depreciation warnings. 
I changed, `tf.initialize_all_variables()` to `tf.global_variables_initializer()`

![k80-test](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5735406/22568553/144ef162-e9f9-11e6-906f-54a96cc6ac9a.PNG)
